org.threadly.test.concurrent

Class TestCondition

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.test.concurrent.TestCondition

  • public class TestCondition
extends java.lang.Object
    TestCondition in unit test, designed to check a condition for something that is happening in a different thread. Allowing a test to efficiently block till the testable action has finished.

    This tool is used often within threadly's own unit tests. Please use those as examples using this class.

    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  TestCondition.ConditionTimeoutException
      Thrown if condition is still false after a given timeout.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TestCondition

        public TestCondition()
        This constructor is expected to have get() overridden, otherwise an exception will be thrown when this condition is checked/used.

      • TestCondition

        public TestCondition(java.util.function.Supplier<java.lang.Boolean> condition)
        Construct a new test condition with a provided supplier for when the state changes. Alternatively this can be constructed with TestCondition() and then the condition can be reported by overriding get().
        Parameters:
        condition - Condition to check
        Since:
        5.0

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public boolean get()
        Getter for the conditions current state. If constructed with TestCondition() this must be overridden. Otherwise this will return the result from the provided supplier at construction.
        Returns:
        Test condition state, true if ready

      • blockTillTrue

        public void blockTillTrue()
        Blocks till condition is true, useful for asynchronism operations, waiting for them to complete in other threads during unit tests.

        This uses a default timeout of 10 seconds, and a poll interval of 10ms

      • blockTillTrue

        public void blockTillTrue(int timeoutInMillis)
        Blocks till condition is true, useful for asynchronism operations, waiting for them to complete in other threads during unit tests.

        This uses the default poll interval of 10ms

        Parameters:
        timeoutInMillis - time to wait for value to become true

      • blockTillTrue

        public void blockTillTrue(int timeoutInMillis,
                          int pollIntervalInMillis)
        Blocks till condition is true, useful for asynchronism operations, waiting for them to complete in other threads during unit tests.
        Parameters:
        timeoutInMillis - time to wait for value to become true
        pollIntervalInMillis - time to sleep between checks
